The location of the hotel is not convenient. It is inside a compound where taxi/Grab will charge you a parking fee when they enter. Food delivery rider will refuse to send to the hotel lobby because if they bring their motorcycle in, they will be charged a parking fee. Or if they leave their bike outside, it is a long walk to the back of the building where the hotel is. The room is clean but toilet not so. The fittings are rusty. The shower wall is mouldy. The room is so small, one cannot even lay out the prayer mat. There is only one bottle of cleasing liquid. You need to buy your own shampoo and conditioner. The pouch they put the toothbrush is dirty. Maybe they keep using the same one. The mini fridge in the room is totally useless. It is the inefficient kind. My food got spoiled! Fyi, the fridge is not the normal compression type. It is barely cold. Even drinks in can won't be cooled. The most appropriate name for this type of fridge - the idiot fridge. The shelving is more for aesthetics but not practical. The uppermost shelf is inaccessible. There is no space to put your bags. Or to open your bags. No space to unpack your clothes. Only 2 hangers to hang your clothes. Only 1 bath towel per person. No face towel, no hand towel. No tissue at all. God forbid should you need tissue. The bottle to collect drinking water is not clean. The room slipper is low quality, it hurts your skin. For breakfast, only one type of fruit available. Food is generally too salty. The jams in the bowls are messy. Also, it takes a long while before you can get the lift. Finally, the welcome cakes are a lovely touch. But they are displayed on a plastic tray uncovered. The cakes were dried up already. Also, it is not hygienic because no cover. The cakes do not taste good at all. The end. Thank you.

YELLO Harmoni is a good choice for a short business stay. The check-in process is quick and easy, with staff proactively confirming the arrival time. The room, though not very large, is comfortable and clean, with useful amenities like a safety box, mini fridge, electric kettle, and instant coffee. The bathroom has adequate toiletries, a working hairdryer, and fully functional hot water. The restaurant serves a good variety of food, including Western, local, and oriental options, which are tasty and above average for a budget hotel. A special welcome gesture of small cakes in the room adds a nice personal touch. However, there are a few drawbacks. The flooring and bathroom could use some improvements, and the in-room water supply is limited to empty bottles with refills available only in the hallway. The hotel was quite crowded during the stay, possibly due to events, and construction in front of the hotel made street strolling less convenient. Despite these minor issues, the hotel offers a comfortable experience with good food and a convenient location, making it a solid choice for business travelers.

The pouch they put the toothbrush is dirty. Maybe they keep using the same one. The mini fridge in the room is totally useless. It is the inefficient kind. My food got spoiled! The shelving is more for aesthetics but not practical. The uppermost shelf is inaccessible. There is no space to put your bags. Or to open your bags. No space to unpack your clothes. Only 2 hangers to hang your clothes. Only 1 bath towel per person. No face towel, no hand towel. No tissue at all. God forbid should you need tissue. The bottle to collect drinking water is not clean. The room slipper is low quality, it hurts your skin. For breakfast, only one type of fruit available. Food is generally too salty. The jams in the bowls are messy. Also, it takes a long while before you can get the lift. Finally, the welcome cakes are a lovely touch. But they are displayed on a plastic tray uncovered. The cakes were dried up already. Also, it is not hygienic because no cover. The cakes do not taste good at all. The end. Thank you.

I booked for my quarentine in Yellow hotels. 3 days 2 nights with 3 meals a day. I arrived first day at 20pm afternoon starving and when they bring me the dinner, the portion was very small. I ask them for a bigger portion, adding also i just only took 1 meal and paid for the whole day. I told them via phone room service, but after the call they never replied me back, even i was calling room service many times, no one was answer. In the night the shower doesnt work with hot water also the smell from of the water was discusting. Also connection wifi was lost continuously during the night. Next day I call room service again. After trying for 20 minutes finally someone take the phone I ask for some water. The bottle of 600ml come after one hour waiting. The food was very small portion but the taste was okey. I was waiting for PCR doctors came in the second night, staff told me they will come early night. After waiting them and trying to call room service with no answer i went to sleep. My surprise, they arrive at 2am in the morning, waking me up. And Bcs they told me the results will be done at 12pm i booked my flight at 16pm, same day. Next day i ask for the results and explain them that my flight will be around 16pm and they told me again that at 12pm the result will be done and they will give it to me as soon as they have it. At 12pm I was calling room service, but again no one answer. After 1 hour waiting in the room and thinking about I probably will loose my flight, I went down to the lobby asking for the results. The results were on the desk, but no one take care of it, even when i told them I was in a rush. After took the results, they ask me for room card but i tell them i need it bcs all my staff was inside of the room. My surprise again, i arrived to my room (after waiting 10min for the elevator) and the card didnt opened the door because they disconected. Spent at least 20 min more to go down, explain them the situation and coming back to the room to pick up my belongs. Crazy. Last thing in the last day... Lunch was not included. So instead of 3 meals x day x 3 days (what they offered, so in total 9meals) i got only 5 meals included in my 3 days of quarentine with a payment of 2.9juta. In general terms, bad communication and bad service. Food taste okey but very small portions, not enough water, no hot water in the shower. Wifi fails continuously during night, AC works the same in 35degree or in 5degree but the noisy fan is always On (even if you turn Off) , and honestly, i dont know why they put a phone in the room, because when you use it no one wants to pick up the call. Im very dissapointed and of course if someone ask me i will not recommend this. Im sure u can find better options around with trusted announcements for quarentine. Hope this help somebody.

Stayed there for 10 days quarantine. Me and friend stayed in 2 separate rooms. Arrived at 12 noon, only 1 room was ready for check in. Waited about half hour n staff gave us snacks. Room cleanliness can be improved, like rubbish bin were yellowish/had food stains (if you stay for quarantine you need to replace the bags yourself). Nice view and comfortable bed. Soap is 3in1 style. Walls are not very soundproof, I keep hearing my neighbor cough/etc. Also noticed he put his phone on the bed side table (connected to the wall). Everytime his phone vibrates, I can hear it. He has an alarm at 6 everyday zzzzzzz Food is awful (sorry). If you are not picky you'll be fine, but bound to be bored by almost the same food everyday. Taste is bland and sauces feel like were cooked separate from the meat. Very dry most of the time. Fruits not fresh. Laundry was good n reliable for me but during the 10 days my friend had problem with them twice (instead of taking 1 day, took 2 days instead). Other reviews about smelly water is factual, but it's only for like 1 minute after you turn it on. Phone in the room is useless. If you use it to call operator, they just direct you to a WhatsApp number. If you use it to call room service, no one picks up. So you can't order food from anywhere else. You also cant use gojek/grabfood. I WhatsApped the given number asking when the 2nd pcr test will be performed, they said the day before check out between 9 to 10. I asked if can do at 11 instead due to personal calls. They called on the day and asked me to come at 9 (finally there's a use for the telephone in the room). I ended up going at 10, process was smooth. One thing that is 5 star is the operation staff who is always smiling and helpful (this does not extend to the person running the whatsapp account as sometimes the responses r slow and they do not address the questions). When you check in they give you general TnC to sign, like water will be given at this time, laundry at that time. Well, none of the timings are correct. If you want extra water just whatsapp (very slow) or wait til the cleaning service comes and just ask for it. Alternatively ask for extra water when they deliver your meal. Can also leave a note on the floor... This was one of the cheapest hotel available (but not anymore). I guess it's pretty standard. The most important critic is the food. Thanks

But most of the time the wifi was off. I got disconnected during online session with my clients several times and it was very frustating. The mobile reception was also bad, probably because I stayed at the top floor. 4. They told me that theyâ€™re going to have a PCR test at 1-3am in the morning on my last day. I stayed up all night only to finally had my test at 5am (after I called the front office asking if they would conduct any test at all). 5. The quarantine protocol was very loose. You could easily leave your hotel during your stay, to get a coffee or go to a nearby shopping mall, without anyone to stop you. Other hotels have dedicated floors for quarantine guests and put their staff to monitor the floor on frequent basis. But this did not. Iâ€™m sorry to leave such a poor review in this difficult time. But I was not impressed during my stay and I hope you can fix them.
